components.description:
A locked (closed) padlock with a fountain pen or nib positioned at various angles in front of it. Vendors implement the same design as their üîí Locked and the same or similar design as their üñãÔ∏è Fountain Pen or ‚úíÔ∏è Black Nib.

May represent digital certificates in public-key technology. May also have similar applications as üîí Locked (privacy, security) and üñãÔ∏è Fountain Pen or ‚úíÔ∏è Black Nib (writing, signing).

Apple’s design previously displayed a nib, as did Google’s.

This emoji does not display in page titles on Apple’s Safari web browser, presumably to prevent less reputable sites from pretending to be secure (encrypted using HTTPS).

Additionally, this emoji is not supported in Twitter / X names, to minimize confusion with private accounts on the platform. Learn more here.
components.title: Lock with Ink Pen

title: Lock with Ink Pen

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> User interface symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A locked (closed)¬†padlock,¬†with an ink pen (otherwise known as a fountain pen) next to it.¬†May related to key signing, a term used in digita http://emojipedia.org/lock-with-ink-pen/
emoji_net_data.name: locked with pen

bn:00110253a: Not open or public; kept private or not revealed
Being or kept hidden from public perception.

bn:00051771n: Something used for fastening, which can only be opened with a key or combination.
A fastener fitted to a door or drawer to keep it firmly closed
A lock is a mechanical or electronic fastening device that is released by a physical object, by supplying secret information, or by a combination thereof.

apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the locked with pen emoji showcases a classic padlock rendered in a polished metallic finish, reflecting light with Apple‚Äôs signature glossy 3D shading.  Adjacent to it, a quill pen rests thoughtfully, its feather detail and ink tip appearing delicate and refined through Apple‚Äôs smooth gradients. This emoji on Apple devices signifies secure writing, protected ideas, or authorized access to creative or sensitive information, blending security with intellectual pursuits.
